prompt: What rule allows us to derive R from (P → Q), (Q → R)?
explanation: Hypothetical Syllogism (HS): From (P → Q) and (Q → R), derive (P → R). If P leads to Q and Q leads to R, then P leads to R. We can chain implications together.
visual_concept: Dominoes: If A knocks down B, and B knocks down C, then A (ultimately) knocks down C.
